item.title: Burial (another account)
item.summary: When a person dies, the !kun (!nanni's people) do not immediately leave the place of death but leave as a group on another day. In !nanni's maternal grandfather's country, the dead go into the Moon.
item.comments: 1) p.9251v: Lloyd notes that the belief about the moon and the dead came as an answer to a question she had asked the boys comparing this belief to a similar superstition held by the |xam, 2) See also Customs at death and Sleeping in ashes and Burial, 3) This story is found in Book XI & XII-4
